newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: North Korean fugitives in gunfight in South Korea.
newsitem.headline: North Korean fugitives in gunfight in South Korea.

text.p: South Korean security forces exchanged gunfire with two North Korean infiltrators still at large after a group of around 20 landed by submarine in the South on Wednesday, television news reported.

The clash near an airport serving the east coast city of Kangnung started at 10.00 p.m. (1300 GMT) and lasted for about 15 minutes, the reports said. The two fled and are now being hunted by troops and police. Earlier, 11 of the infiltrators were found dead, possibly shot by one of their number who also used the gun on himself.
There was no word on any injuries from the shootout.
Authorities believe up to nine North Koreans are hiding around the Kangnung area close to a beach where the submarine was spotted early on Wednesday stranded on a reef.
One of the infiltrators has been captured alive.

A night curfew has been clamped on the area where thousands of security personnel using sniffer dogs and backed by helicopters spent the day combing through scrubland. It will be lifted at first light on Thursday.
